alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 5:29PM CDT until October 27 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Bexar, Caldwell, Comal, Guadalupe, Hays, Lee, Travis, Williamson and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicates the heavy rains have ended. However, earlier heavy rains up to 4 inches of rain will continue to cause urban and small stream flooding for the next couple of hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Schertz, Kyle, Seguin, Cibolo, Lockhart, Elgin, Floresville, Luling, Poth, Stockdale, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Manor, McQueeney, St. Hedwig, Elmendorf, La Vernia and Martindale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
